column3: concept ACK,  once over utACK\n
Can you put softforks.{cpp,h} under the consensus/ directory?\n
@luke-jr yes.\n
Nice!\nutACK.\n
Concept ACK\n

Long-term isnt the goal to just switch enforcement of most softforks to blockheight/timestamp and then use versionbits globally? (I believe most things were rolled out via a IsSuperMajority-like system, and then the code was just simplified later by replacing the checks with what-the-switchover-date-was checks).\n
@TheBlueMatt indeed - that's exactly what will end up happening once things are buried deeply enough.\n
Mmm, ok, well I hadnt really read the code to begin with and I figured you were jumping the gun, but the code does simplify things on its own, so concept ack that.\n

I checked consensus is not affected by spinning up a new node and syncing from scratch. The node synced to the correct tip @ block 377385, `0000000000000000056d10c5f1cc9961ce2476da818a2fb4dd54ca3bcfb99a8d`

ACK
Rebased atop #6774 to make it easier to review code movements.\n
Apart from my nits on #6774, utACK\n
I liked '''Consensus::GetFlags''' see https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/9ba7d0641019d7f6c08f7b15ce3a2bd2e5e8a4ac even more, but this is definitely a step in the right direction...\n
re-ACK\n
Wouldn't it make sense to rebase this on top of #6816 ?\n
Sorry, I meant to say the following here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6774#issuecomment-168535109\n
rebase or close for now?\n
I think 7575 supersedes this.\n

@btcdrak well, it would need to be greatly rewritten after #7575, but what I think is the general idea it's still possible, see https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/dd446faf641350fb469865fc3586d1e088bdfb00 and https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/032182336d84a420f33be3ab7d204c9b5f8ae8cf \nBut yeah, probably a new PR would be a better idea if it's going to be rewritten.\n
Needs rebase/new pull if still relevant\n
Closing for now\n
Are these  "look in consensus/softfork.cpp" comments really necessary or useful?\n

In my optinion there's no need to include future softforks/hardforks here (perhaps with the exception of BIP65 which is already merged as a policy rule), they can add themselves in their own PRs if they're merged after this.\n
Agreed\n
